<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 7"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Read Shibboleths](/Feats.aspx?ID=6349) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
<trait label="Linguistic" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=642" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=695" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 203 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetypes** [Linguist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=253), [Venture-Gossip](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=311) (Level 7)

**Prerequisites**
[Linguist Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6344); Master in [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)

</column>

---

All communication is filled with slight tells and signals. If you interact with someone for at least 10 minutes, their regional words, pronunciation changes, and nonverbal cues provide you with a minor fact about their social environment, such as their hometown or certain groups they might belong to. If a target of this ability is being deceptive about their social environment, such as a commoner pretending to be a noble, they secretly attempt a [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38), [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47), or appropriate [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) check against your Society DC, providing you a false minor fact consistent with their assumed identity on a success.

Once you’ve gleaned one or more true minor facts about a person, you can then incorporate these mannerisms into your speech to present yourself in a way that they find familiar. This grants you a +1 circumstance bonus to your [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) and Deception checks with them.
name: Read Shibboleths
